name: GetListSegmentsInfo
description:
Retrieve details of all segments for a specific list.

Use this tool to get information about all available segments for a specific list in Mailchimp. It helps in understanding the segmentation structure of a mailing list.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the mailing list whose segments are to be retrieved.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude from the response. Use dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: records_count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default: 10. Max: 1000.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: segment_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of segment to filter results. Use known segment types as strings.

value_schema.description: Limit results based on segment type.

parameters.name: created_after_datetime
parameters.description: Restrict results to segments created after the specified time using ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00).

value_schema.description: Restrict results to segments created after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: restrict_to_segments_created_before
parameters.description: Restrict results to segments created before the specified time. Use ISO 8601 format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

value_schema.description: Restrict results to segments created before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: include_cleaned_members
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to include cleaned (bounced) members in the response. Use this to see members who have been removed due to email issues.

value_schema.description: Include cleaned members in response

parameters.name: include_transactional_members
parameters.description: Specify whether to include transactional members in the response. Use 'true' or 'false'.

value_schema.description: Include transactional members in response

parameters.name: include_unsubscribed_members
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to include unsubscribed members in the response.

value_schema.description: Include unsubscribed members in response

parameters.name: restrict_since_updated_time
parameters.description: Restrict results to segments updated after this time using ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00).

value_schema.description: Restrict results to segments update after the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: restrict_to_segments_updated_before
parameters.description: Restrict results to segments updated before the specified time using ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00).

value_schema.description: Restrict results to segments update before the set time. Uses ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.
